benchmark_details.name: ConceptMath
benchmark_details.overview: ConceptMath is a bilingual (English and Chinese), fine-grained benchmark that evaluates concept-wise mathematical reasoning of Large Language Models (LLMs). It systematically organizes math problems under a hierarchy of math concepts to evaluate mathematical reasoning at different granularity with concept-wise accuracies.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and enhance the mathematical reasoning capabilities of Large Language Models across a diverse set of mathematical concepts in both English and Chinese.

data.source: ConceptMath is created based on a collection of math problems designed for educational use across different concept systems.
data.annotation: Problems were carefully annotated by education professionals and validated by human experts.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the number of correct answers out of total questions in different prompt settings.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy scores indicate better mathematical reasoning capabilities of the evaluated models.
methodology.baseline_results: Various existing LLMs were evaluated against the ConceptMath benchmark to establish baseline performance.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated through extensive evaluation across several LLMs using different prompting techniques.
